info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:04PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Fremont, south central El Paso and northwestern Pueblo Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 402 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Penrose, or 20 miles north of Junkins Burn Scar, moving northwest at 5 mph. Other storms may develop across southern portions of Fort Carson and northern portions of Pueblo West along colliding thunderstorm outflow boundaries. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall may cause quick localized flooding of roads, streams and low water crossings. Locations impacted include... Florence, Penrose, Northern Pueblo West and Canon City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
